@graph.@id: American Telephone & Telegraph Co. v. Central Office Telephone, Inc.
@graph.reasoning: The Communications Act's filed-tariff requirements pre-empt respondent's state-law claims.

@graph.@id: MCI Telecommunications Corp. v. American Telephone & Telegraph Co.
@graph.reasoning: The filed rate doctrine associated with the ICA tariff provisions applies to the Communications Act as well.

@graph.@id: Louisville & Nashville R. Co. v. Maxwell
@graph.reasoning: The rate a carrier duly files is the only lawful charge.

@graph.@id: Kansas City Southern R. Co. v. Carl
@graph.reasoning: Even if a carrier intentionally misrepresents its rate and a customer relies on the misrepresentation, the carrier cannot be held to the promised rate if it conflicts with the published tariff.

@graph.@id: United States v. Wabash R. Co.
@graph.reasoning: Discriminatory privileges are not limited to discounted rates.

@graph.@id: Keogh v. Chicago & Northwestern R. Co.
@graph.reasoning: The ICA's saving clause has long been held to preserve only those rights that are not inconsistent with the statutory filed-rate requirements.
